Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but doesn't say 'Come Back'”
Reviews.Author: cbMoline
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good hotel, but very difficult to park and get into and out of. The elevator to the lobby level is the size of a phone booth that is more like a dumb waiter to go up in with bags and luggage. The escalator is also small and narrow. Parking is an adventure with very tight parking stalls and tight turns into and out of. It would be a much better entrance if it wasn't up at least one level, (closer to two) and then often crowded with cars, which makes it difficult to walk to the parking garage or into the entrance. There are good points at this hotel from the breakfast in the morning and snacks at early evening time, which is the Embassy Suites way. The downside is this hotel seems to have been ‘force-fitted’ into the Indianapolis downtown. Embassy Suites is a good hotel brand, but this location just doesn’t say ‘come back’ because of the above to us. This property is good once inside, but its the coming and going that just makes things uncomfortable. Compare to their properties in other cities, like Covington, KY (Cincinnati), or Omaha and they do say ‘Come Back’ and they are right.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Neil V
Reviews.Content: Great location, awkward entrance though. Room was nice, liked breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Rbuck70
Reviews.Content: This hotel was expensive but is in a good location if you are going to Banker's Life Fieldhouse. Their biggest problem is they advertise free made to order breakfast but do not have enough staff for the breakfast crowd. We were there for 4 nights and each morning the lines were long for the made to order breakfast because they had at the most 2 of the 3 stations open. I went through the buffet line. Every morning they were out of items. Items like, eggs, sausage, forks,coffee or other items. It appeared the management did not know the hotel was full. The wifi is $ 11.95 for 24 hours. I logged on and charged it to my room the first night and then couldn't get on the next morning. They wanted to bring a booster unit to the room and I decided I didn't want to be bothered. They did take the $11.95 off my bill. If you stay at this hotel don't bother to pay for wifi. The rooms need to be updated. Carpets are old and worn as are the furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but awkward entrance”
Reviews.Author: marjorie w
Reviews.Content: Pleasant 2 night stay here recently - the room was very nice, staff were excellent, and breakfast was decent. But the entrance is just bizarre: a dark, unkempt, twisting alley shared with an entrance to a parking ramp, about 40 stair steps, and an unmanned entrance into a dark well of escalators. I've never stayed in a hotel that didn't have a main floor street entrance. We were very uncomfortable walking through here after a late game, and won't stay here again. If you have a stroller, wheelchair, or any sort of infirmity, you'll never get inside. It's too bad, because otherwise it's a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Indy Acceptable Option”
Reviews.Author: mke60
Reviews.Content: Indianapolis hosts lots of big events, Superbowl XLVI notwithstanding, and they do a great job at it. If you're in town for an event, downtown is the place to be--pay the premium vs. suburban budget chains. Downtown is easy to negotiate, just park your car, and walk everywhere to dining and entertainment. Downtown hotels that are connected to the Circle Center are preferable for convenience, I think there are seven (?), and Embassy Suites (ES) is one of them. In your hotel search, if ES is available, don’t hesitate to book it. Any flaws will be overshadowed by the preferable location. If other hotels linked or adjacent to Circle Center are available and are rate competitive, give them a close look, but if they are booked or pricier, ES will be fine. Very predictable for a first generation downtown Embassy Suites. Based on reviews, I suspect some rooms are renovated, but not all. Ours wasn't, but it was well maintained, if not a bit dated. They do a good job at handling the masses when the hotel is booked at the manager's reception and the breakfast, not always the case at some Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at fair price.”
Reviews.Author: Will F
Reviews.Content: Staid here nearly 10yrs ago for IU basketball tournament downtown when Circle Center Mall was first built. Was a wonderful hotel then and still is today. You could tell that the room had been recently updated (Thank you Superbowl). I can't say enough for how easy it is to get around the city of Indianapolis without using your car. We were just a short walk away from the mall and never had to step foot outside. We went to Colts Texans game and were just a short, safe walk from the stadium. The staff was fantastic. All we encountered were polite and helpful. Didn't have time to visit pool or gym with all of the Christmas shopping we had to do. Breakfast was great. Had buffet and made to order omelet. My only ding would be the parking situation. The parking garage is tight and not exclusive to hotel. There are many that park there for the IRT and the Mall. All of this to be expected in its downtown location. Would most certainly stay in this top notch hotel again the next time I am downtown for ballgame, concert, play, or shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: P2Loves2Travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Dec.20, 2011 and they went above and beyond to meet our needs. I prebooked a corner king suite for one night. I called the day of to confirm the suite since I have had issues with them in the past. Once again, I ran into the same issue of them upgrading a previous guest. When the gentleman explained they had overbooked the corner king I explained to him that I had already prepaid and it was a special occassion ( sister graduating from college). He came back shortly after, apologized once again, and explained that he had upgraded us to a Penthouse Suite free of charge. I was very pleased. They went on to impress us when we arrived with a bottle of champagne, Godiva Chocolates, and a card to congratulate my sister for graduating college. This would be easily 5 stars, however the fact they overbooked in the first place on a prepaid room I still do not understand and the breakfast was very weak.

Reviews.Title: “dirty with sour management”
Reviews.Author: bet s
Reviews.Content: after checking in found hairs all over the turned down sheets- was dismissed as a demanding guest- what a horrifing experience- STAY AWAY

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Solitaire078
Reviews.Content: I actually didn't choose this hotel, we got it through name your price on Priceline. So I cannot complain too much. The hotel itself was right in downtown, connected to circle center mall. The entrance to the hotel is pretty weird but good in a way because you have some kind of privacy. The hotel itself is pretty old, even though they are doing renovations, you really can tell. We checked in at night, so I'm not sure if there is valet or bell service is available. We did everything by ourselves. The self parking is $20 per day! The parking garage was very old and had a very narrow entrance. There is an escalator to go up to the lobby. But we had a lot of bags, so we had to get our own cart and use the service elevator to get to our room. The elevator smelled like trash. But finally we get to our room, and I was happy. Even though our room was right in front of the guest elevator, it was quiet. We had a newly renovated room. It was clean and there were so many amenities! 2 flat screen tvs, 2 sinks (one in the front and one in the room) and a huge bed! The bathroom was pretty small, but since there is a sink outside it really didn't matter to me. The lobby is pretty! Also they have interesting elevators (see pics). There was hot breakfast in the morning and made to order omelets. They also had a variety of TAZO tea. Overall the staff was friendly and the room was satisfactory. My only concern about staying in this hotel again is that I found black mold on the windows. Then again, I'm not sure if other rooms also have that problem.

Reviews.Title: “Feels dated - service was very low”
Reviews.Author: Friendaza1
Reviews.Content: I checked in with my family for a mid-week visit to the Children's Museum. A bell staff to help with luggage was non-existent and when we got to our room, the decor and amenities (outside the new TV's) was very dated. This Embassy is connected to a mall, which made dinner very easy for our family. The breakfast was of lower quality than other Embassy Suites, so we went to Panera (connected to hotel). I'm a Hilton Honors Diamond and will try other Indy Hilton properties before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Reggiefox
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip. It was convenient to the convention center. You could walk inside the whole way through the mall. The size of the room was nice, though the ceilings felt low. It was clean and comfortable. One of the elevators was not operating through my four day stay, but if I walked to the other side, I usually didn't have to wait too long. The breakfast was good enough. I had a friend who stayed in the penthouse suite on the top floor, so I was able to see those rooms too. They had a very strange layout with a king size bed in an open loft to the rest of the room. There were two bathrooms but I'm not sure why you would need them and a small kitchenette that did not have any dishes, so again I'm not sure what you would do with it. I wouldn't pay extra for the top floor. There was a nice balcony, but the view was only of the street below and the building across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: toefam4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to this hotel for our 25th anniversary. On arrival, Anita was so helpful and sweet. We had originally put in for what was called a "e-stay upgrade" where if an upgraded room was available and not booked yet by another customer at our arrival we could upgrade for an additional fee, but cheaper than the real price of the room. When Anita heard it was our 25th Anniversary, she gave us the upgraded room (2-floor penthouse on the 20th floor) for no additional charge and sent a complimentary wine and cheese/fruit tray to our room later that evening. We were made to feel so special. The next day at checkout we stopped to say thank you and she walked us to the elevator and hugged us. It was the absolute best hotel experience we have ever had. The room was very nice as well. Extremely clean and comfortable. Two baths - one with nice soaking tub and one with a walk in shower. Dining room, kitchennette, living room and loft bedroom with an extremely comfortable bed. The managers reception and full cooked to order breakfast is also excellent as well. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the downtown Indy area. Thank you, Anita, for making this such a special experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nicer than I expected”
Reviews.Author: laurenyulan
Reviews.Content: Given the mixed reviews....I was a little nervous upon arrival. Frankly, I probably would have passed on this hotel b/c of the reviews but the location was very important to us b/c we were in town for the Big Ten game and all the other hotels were filling up quick so we held our breath. In the end, it was nicer than I expected. We had no problem finding the hotel, arriving around 4:30pm. Unloaded and hubby parked the car. We let the bellhop take our luggage up and the rest of the family went up on the guest elevators. I went with the bellhop on the service elevator and can see why others complained-it was down right disgusting. I don't think they intend for guests to use it but it's bad even for staff. Check-in was a 5 minute wait. I had booked a king suite and at check-in asked if a renovated room was available. Yes but the bedding arrangement was one queen and one twin, plus the sofa bed. He added that it was a corner-unit which is more spacious so we took it. He wasn't kidding. The living area was very roomy and we had a view of the Capitol Building. Room was very clean. The beds were comfortable, with the exception of the sofa bed (ouch...good thing my 8 y/o was dog tired each night and didn't notice). Pool was clean and water warm...hot tubs needed a little attention so we stayed out of them. Breakfast was ok-standard fare. I loved the location of the hotel as it's so central to everything and connected to the skywalk. We would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of heating/cooling system - major flaw”
Reviews.Author: winetraveler80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 12/3/11. I am a Hilton Honors Gold member. Overall nice place and absolutely great location. Service was fine. The biggest issue I had was with the in-room heating and cooling system. Its downright bizarre. Next to the ancient thermostat and fan control, there is a small sign that tries to explain it. In summary, you can only control heat in the winter months and cooling in summer months. So in my case, where it was a temperate early december weekend (approx 45 degrees) the room was 75 degrees+, there is with no way to set the room temperature (in my case to try and cool the room down) at night other than to open the window or turn on the ceiling fan (I'm guessing they added the ceiling fans to try and address this problem). Call me picky, but this is simply unacceptable in this day and age. For $200+ plus a night, you should have a reasonable expecation of a thermostat you can set and the heating cooling system will automatically adjust to the appropriate temp. To net it out, slept terrible. If your sensative to room temperature...stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Average Embassy - but help is on the way”
Reviews.Author: billsinaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 13th floor and it is in need of some repair. Very dated bath, but otherwise it's fine. The good news is they were renovating a couple of floors below us. Great location by numerous restaurants and interior access to the Mall and Convention Center. A short walk to Lucas.

Reviews.Title: “Fine during waking hours, not so nice at night”
Reviews.Author: Whitleywalker
Reviews.Content: I've always enjoyed staying at Embassy Suites because of the suite design, but I had some issues with this stay at Indianapolis downtown. Upon close inspection the room looks worn and could use a remodel. The couch had a big stain on the upholstery, wallpaper was coming away from the wall in the bathroom, corners were nicked - all things that come with use. As others have noted, the only way to cool the room after October is to open the window and turn on the ceiling fan provided in the bedroom. That I can live with, but the ceiling fan made such a loud noise that I couldn't have it on when trying to sleep. And regarding noise, a very loud roar was coming from a nearby building - we guessed the exhaust fans for the Weber Grill. Luckily I brought earplugs and finally resorted to those. My husband said the roar quit in the middle of the night. (Maybe when Weber Grill closed down?) The mattress was comfortable and the bed linens were very nice. The televisions were great with a good selection of channels. The location downtown is fantastic and it is tied in to the downtown skywalk system. I think maybe the noise issue is dependent upon where in the hotel you are located. We were on the 9th floor facing north (hence suspecting Weber Grill noise). The ceiling fan issue is probably just one of those things. I would recommend management have their maintenance staff check for noisy fans and fix or replace them. I've stayed at this ES in years past and found it quite pleasant - however, I do remember being on one of the top floors in a past winter and finding it quite hard to cool off the room due to the heat naturally rising in a large open atrium like ES. It's probably time for ES to refurbish the paint and wallpaper in the rooms at this location as well. I still find the suite set up very comfortable, and the complimentary breakfast is very nice. We had the typical option of cereals, pastries, breads, plus fresh fruit; but they also provide a hot bar with eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits and gravy; and made to order omelets. Very nice! They provide a manager's reception in the early evening with snacks and drinks. We did not take advantage of it on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a busy part of town”
Reviews.Author: gilkesjm
Reviews.Content: Plenty of restaurants and lots of excitement around the hotel. The rooms were a bit dated in a few respects - furniture in front room is aging. The bathroom looks relatively updated. The location is likely the best aspect of this hotel. Walking distance to most everything in downtown Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice”
Reviews.Author: Loscoe
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. It is clean, conveniently located, and the staff was helpful. I would stay here again if I were in town.

Reviews.Title: “colts weekend”
Reviews.Author: kandvr
Reviews.Content: stayed here again. really like the location. close to everything. free breakfast, not bad. little disappointed they didn't have bisquits and gravy this time. managers happy hour (actually 2 hrs), was very relaxing. we had traveled with another couple, and it was nice to have a few drinks and visit without yelling over music/noise. lots of construction downtown, for superbowl. but no roads closed that we saw. parking is $20 a day. also, internetis $12 a day, unless you are a highly rated hilton club member. really feel they should give internet for free. laquinta, 5 blocks away, does. all in all, we enjoy staying here. we have stayed here numerous times on trips to indy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: CharlesRalph
Reviews.Content: Was just there for 5 days for a conference. Everything downtown is under an awning, so you can move from place to place without the weather. The pool, jacuzzi and sauna were open and clean and not crowded. The nightly reception was good with free beer, wine, or mixed drinks (sure beats paying $7/drink at a bar or restauraunt). The Green Line bus service takes you from the airport to the downtown for $7 and drops you at the hotel. Only complaint I have is no Pepsi Products in the machines (available for $1.79 in the gift shop) and no Comedy Central Channel on their cable. Everybody was super friendly, highly recommend this place. Try to Webber Grill restaurant next door.

Reviews.Title: “FFA National Convention”
Reviews.Author: Jack T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our trip to the national FFA convention in 2011. The rooms were very comfortable. The breakfast was a little better than average, but not much. The entrance was a little weird, looked very much like an entry to a parking garage. Good atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Choice”
Reviews.Author: davidb60878
Reviews.Content: Entry is filthy, littered with garbage, looks like a service entrance. There is an off-track betting business in the lobby area as you enter the place. Recently remodeled room was in poor shape. Building has a run down feeling to it throughout. Had to complain to front desk to get room cleaned. This hotel is very popular for local conferences, conventions, etc, which makes it noisy and makes an elevator ride from the lobby to an upper floor a ten minute ride. I have stayed in a number of Embassy Suite hotels, most good to very good and none as bad as this one. Pluses - ceiling fan and window that opens just a little. Minuses - everything above plus furnishings that look twenty years old. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Bring your Wallet for all the extras, that shouldnt be.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler559
Reviews.Content: Typical Embassy suites Hotel very nice but for $ 220.00 a nite I would expect free parking $20 for one day and free internet 11.95 per stay. Stay at the Hampton and save yourself about $120.00 for the same if not better service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Weather Not An Issue”
Reviews.Author: drifter33
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a trade show and chose this location instead of the Omni. The location is conveniently connected to the Circle Center mall for any last minute things you may need. It also connects to the Skywalk so you can walk to most places downtown indoors if the weather is bad. The made to order breakfast is good, but the continental offerings are better than most other hotels. Lucas Oil Stadium is a short walk away. There are every type of eating and drinking establishments in every price category within a 3 block radius walk as well. The rooms are clean and spacious and the sitting area is comfy. I found the hotel to be quiet as well. There is a casino built in the basement, but you don't really know its there. There seem to be an increase in panhandlers downtown, but not in front of this hotel. Plan ahead as all of the road construction on one-way streets downtown makes navigating tricky.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location. Good rooms at fair price.”
Reviews.Author: AggieTraveler98
Reviews.Content: Nice Embassy connected well to downtown amenities and close to Lucas Oil Field, Statehouse and Convention Center. Colts Sports Bar downstairs had great food and atmosphere. Good free breakfast and manager's reception. Connected to Roof Ballroom which was an amazing atmosphere. Great location...OK price.

Reviews.Title: “NOT stroller friendly”
Reviews.Author: SalukiPA-C
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel is ok once you are inside of the room. But getting there can be challenging. To start, there is no true front door. There is a small sign, on a road under heavy construction, that leads to an entrance up a hill to a covered area. This is the 2nd floor. If you have a stroller or are unable to use a narrow escalator, you have to get in to a service elevator that is barely big enough for a single stroller and one person. You take this (mashing your finger on the up/down button the entire ride) to the 3rd floor (lobby). From here, you can get in to a regular elevator. Now, this is from the parking area. If you want to go to the street level, for say dinner, you have to take the regular elevator to the service elevator, walk past the off-track betting facility, down several long hall ways and take another elevator to the street level. Let me tell you, if you have kids, this is terrible. As for the room, it was ok. The guy at the test claimed we were on the most renovated floor, but the tub leaked water at a pretty good rate. It is a little loud in the rooms from the lobby, but this is an embassy, so I have come to expect that. Unfortunately, our room wasn't cleaned very well as I found soap and shampoo in our tub from the previous guests. Breakfast from the buffet was cold, but the appetizers during the manager's reception were fine. The parking garage is difficult to maneuver, with tiny parking spots and the elevators from the garage to the parking level of the hotel appeared to not have been cleaned in years. Next time, I'm staying somewhere else. p.s. the mall connected to the hotel is GHETTO...I have never seen 3 police officers and 4+ mall security guards in a food court at 5pm. Definitely didn't feel like this was somewhere I wanted to spend time or money.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at this Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: KSMeadowlark
Reviews.Content: We stay at this Embassy Suites in downtown Indianapolis while attending the annual dance party sponsored by the Southern Rhapsody Dance Society. The Rooftop Ballroom is attached to this hotel, so we walk from our room to the dance location without having to go outdoors. That is a real plus. This year we arrived early and before our room was ready. We were able to leave our luggage with the concierage, and happily found it in our room when we returned from shopping. Once again, we were very pleased with the size of the suite and we had a better view of downtown Indianapolis than last year. No complaints or concerns with the room. We were pleased with the in-room safe, the microwave and the refridgerator. The bed was very comfortable. The temperature of our room was very comfortable even with the almost 100 degree outside summer days. The desk staff was friendly, courteous and very helpful. They are the best attribute of this hotel, in my opinion. We were pleased that the elevators were all operational this year and it seemed that they moved between floors faster than just a year ago. There were plenty of food options provided at the morning breakfast. When we arrived, the hotel was very full of guests from a national fraternity, their spouses and friends occupying most of the rooms in this hotel and the hotels nearby. They were a loud, rowdy bunch, and a lot of fun to be around. Although they spent many late evenings, partying in the atrium area on the main floor, our room was very quiet. As the fraternity folks left and the our dance party friends arrived, the hotel became much quieter and more sedate with the arrival of our senior citizen friends. I missed the noisy, happy fraternity guests. This hotel is directly across the street from a large shopping mall and within easy walking distance to the State Capital and state offices. The Eiteljorg Museum of American Indians and Western Art and the Indiana State Museum is six or seven blocks from the hotel. You can also walk to the Indianapolis Zoo and White River Gardens which is maybe 1/2 mile from the hotel. Bicycle rentals and bike-cart rentals are located near the White River Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelinVC
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites in downtown Indianapolis is a pretty standard Embassy Suites. Like all the others, it has a central atrium, breakfast in the morning, evening reception, etc. They are in the process of remodeling the rooms. The remodeled rooms are nicer than the old rooms; however, the old rooms are definitely in need of the remodeling. Make sure you ask for a remodelled room :-) On the last visit, I was upgraded to the top floor which has duplex suites. This was a mixed bonus though. The space is quite large but these suites have not been remodelled.The bedroom is on the second floor of the duplex and it includes a jacuzzi, which was nice but awkward to get into and out of given that there was an odd platform arrangement around the tub, There is a kitchen on the first floor but there are no utensils or dinnerware, so I'm not sure how one would use the stove. If I had actually paid for the duplex I would have been very disappointed given the shabby state of the wallpaper as well as the numerous lamps throughout the suite that did not work correctly.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: Aprilia_Motogp
Reviews.Content: Located smack downtown in Indianapolis, the Embassy Suites is a great hotel if you are staying for more than a few days. Whenever I stay for business, I am there Mon thru Friday, so it is convenient to be where all the restaurants, parking, and stores are. Hotel staff is friendly and the hotel is connected to the downtown mall. Can't beat the free breakfast and happy hour either.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and disgusting parking garage.”
Reviews.Author: shakergrandma
Reviews.Content: The filthy and disgusting parking garage was horrible for me to walk through and very scary! The entrance to hotel feels and looks like a service entrance. Once you enter the hotel the first thing you notice is the off track betting lobby which does not give a good impression. Once up the elevator and into the actual hotel everything seems like a normal Embassy Suites Hotel. The room was clean, spacious and well stocked. Make up mirror in the bathroom was a plus! Coffee maker in the room, comfy bed, smaller sized bathroom but there was an extra vanity in the bedroom which was nice. As a female traveller I would not stay there again--the parking garage was too scary and very dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: may2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriends for a weekend Women's Retreat. At check in we were upgraded to a penthouse suite due to having a Diamond Status. (travel awards) We had a fabulous corner room on the 20th floor with a balcony that had a view of downtown Indy to just die for!! The room was 2 bedroom, 2 bath and was huge!! The bed was soo comfortable and the shampoo products were top quality. The only suggestion I would have for the room would be to upgrade to better tolite paper.. This is a super nice penthouse with sandpaper for t.p. lol. The breakfast was very good if you like eggs. I would prefer pancakes or waffles. All the employees that helped us were super friendly. We used the bell hop area to hold our luggage & they were so nice! I can't wait to come back again next year for the conf. again. We had a great visit & loved the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “LOUD!”
Reviews.Author: Jerry H
Reviews.Content: Nothing like staying in a hotel for a nice romantic weekend and being over run by a fraternity convention. The front desk staff did what they could but this property needs to get this under control as this apparently is an annual event according to the front desk. Look I was a college fraternity kid at one time. Kids will be kids but it is the job of management to set expectations when the organizers check in. Wish I could tell you about the reception and breakfast but alas they were so understaffed it wasn't worth the wait. Good location downtown but beyond that...not so much.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all, actully just fine.”
Reviews.Author: MMMike53
Reviews.Content: Despite some strangeness on the egress and ingress (walking up a bunch of steps, then taking an escalator to the lobby on the 4th floor, or taking the parking garage elevator to the steps), the room was very clean, spacious and well-laid out. Bed was comfortable and bathroom was totally fine. The breakfast was nothing short of awesome (too bad I'm on a diet). I prefer the Indy Downtown Hilton just because for me it's a little better location and the in-and-out is a little quicker, but this is definitely an acceptable backup.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: JulesAnnL
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Embassy Suites in other cities and have always enjoyed our stay. Embassy Suites Downtown was no different! The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. My husband and I enjoyed the Manager's Reception with free snacks and beverages starting at 5:30 each afternoon for a couple of hours. However, the snacks were very limited...chips and dip-type food. It would be nice if they would expand that a little and add more variety. Embassy Suites provide a wonderful complimentary hot breakfast, and this location was no different. Omeletes made-to-order, eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage, french toast, fruit, cereal, pastries and bread, juice, coffee, etc. Our teenagers loved it! It was great! Our room was on the 17th floor. The front desk said our room was recently remodeled. The furnishings looked like it...very taseful. It was spacious with the bedroom in a separate room than the living area. We even had a ceiling fan in the bedroom! The living area had a pull out couch, a chair, desk with chair and a small kitchenette-type area with a mini microwave, a mini fridge and small sink. There was a vanity area in the bedroom, separate from the bathroom as well, which was helpful for our family getting ready for our day each morning. The only drawback with our room was that we could hear noise and voices all night from the atrium below, sleeping on the pull-out couch in the living area. It was quiet though, in the bedroom with the door shut. The hotel was in walking distance to all of what we wanted to do downtown...either with outside sidewalks or the skywalks through the different buildings. The Circle Centre Mall was attached through the sky walk, as well as many restaurants. Lucas Oil Stadium and Conseco Fieldhouse is in walking distance also! We wished that the hotel had free high speed internet (was about $10 a day--and we chose not to pay that). Parking was expensive at $20/day, but we had unlimited re-entry. We'll plan to stay here again the next time we visit Indianapolis!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoVacation4
Reviews.Content: My sons and I decided to plan a trip to Indy to celebrate my husband's birthday. We have stayed at other Embassy Suites and always found them to be nice. I was quite disappointed with this location however. Things started out well. After a 4 hour drive, we arrived at 3PM. The hotel entrance was easy to find since I knew we would be driving into a building. I went to the front desk and fully expected to be turned away as it was an hour before check in. I was pleasantly surprised when the very friendly woman at the front desk told me she had a room for us on the 16th floor! When I made our reservations on-line I mentioned in the comments section that we were celebrating my husbands birthday and would appreciate a room on an upper level. She even told me to wish my husband (who was waiting in the car) a happy birthday. So far so good! I went back out to the car and told my family our room was ready! We parked in the attached garage which was easy to use with our room key for in and out access. We had no elevator trouble at all. We made it to our room with ease. At this point is where the trouble began. We walked into the bedroom and found a huge capsule type pill laying on the floor. It was clear as day, and not hard to see. It was obvious that the carpet had not been vacuumed. We immediately called housekeeping for 2 more towels and pillows, and when they brought them, I asked them to remove the pill from our room. We had no idea what kind of drug it was, and didn't want it left in a garbage can in our room. The woman from housekeeping was very nice, apologized and took the pill with her when she left the room. I then went into the bathroom and found splattered toothpaste on top of the faucet and water spots on the mirror directly about the faucet. At that point, I should have called the front desk and requested a different room, but decided to just make the best of things and go out to explore the city as we had planned. When we returned that evening, my husband pulled the comforter down and found chocolate on the top sheet. Not just a chocolate stain, but an actual piece of chocolate stuck to the sheet. It was late and the kids were ready for bed, so we took off the top sheet and didn't use it. We wrote a note for housekeeping the next day to please change the sheets and left the note on the sheet next to the chocolate explaining that it was from a previous guest (or a snacking housekeeper!) When we went down to the lobby the next morning there was a woman laying face down, sleeping on a bench in the lobby. When we walked by again about 15 minutes later, she was still there and I was concerned that she may need help. I went to the front desk and told the clerk that I was concerned about the woman who was sleeping face down just a few feet away from the front desk. He told me in a very unconcerned and annoyed tone, "we know who she it". I was quite taken aback by his response. Not something that I would expect to see at an Embassy Suites. The breakfast buffet was the usual that you would expect at an Embassy Suites, but the evening reception was below par. On July 3rd, the bartender was not pleasant at all. She was extremely slow in filling drink orders. The night before, the bartender was very nice and efficient, but the carrots that were out, looked as if they were very old, as the color was as much white as orange. They ran out of crackers, and replaced them with little packages of saltines, which seemed a little odd to go with the cheese ball. Overall, a disappointing stay at the downtown Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JLN73
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. We always enjoy Embassy Suites, 2 room suite, cooked to order breakfast, great pool area. This Downtown Indy hotel was close to all attractions we were there to enjoy. Parking was easy in the underground garage.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not the best”
Reviews.Author: drjohn4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a trip to see the Indy 500. The hotel is very nice and right in the downtown area with a lot to see and do around the hotel. The breakfast buffet was good, several hot items, but I have had better at other Embassy Suites hotels. The rooms were nice and well appointed with a large flat-screen TV in the living room (getting HD signal at least for the local stations) and another smaller one in the bedroom. We had a corner room that was nice and big, but there was a little mold on the ceiling over the tub. (room 807 if management cares to take a look) Pool was nice and warm and the kids loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed to say the least.”
Reviews.Author: dewalsh
Reviews.Content: I'm going to start with the negatives: Was not allowed to check in until an hour after arrival (and we arrived an hour after check-in time.) Was not given the room we reserved. They ended up putting us in a standard room without a discounted price. Our television remotes had no batteries, and there was garbage left in the garbage cans. We were also charged with purchasing a movie in the room. How could we with no remote? As for the positives- the balconies are nice and the rooms are very nice. Overall, worst Embassy Suites stay I've had.

Reviews.Title: “typically embassy suites..!”
Reviews.Author: kingrox
Reviews.Content: this E.S is typical of what is offered up at most of their locations... the rooms are great becoz they can sleep 6 if need be.. (you cant say thats not a huge advantage) the free breakfast is good (fills the spot) and the managers happy hour is better than what any other hotels offer up. This E.S is in a fantastic location with plenty of shopping and great food spots very close by. THE STAFF WERE FANTASTIC TOWARD US at all times when dealing with them. A good spot for families and groups. i would stay here in a hartbeat... I must admit im a fan of the E.S chain. great value for money..

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay during Mini Marathon”
Reviews.Author: Hoagy74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this night the same day with a reward certificate on the eve of the Indianapolis Mini Marathon. It's the perfect location to stay for this event. The staff was nice and the rooms were clean. They are on the smallish side of ES rooms, but the bed was very comfortable and the rooms were equipped with nice flat screen tvs. We were happy to be able to walk out the door and down the steps to Washington St to join our corral assignments for the half marathon. Breakfast was typical of ES fare, but the staff was nice and stayed a bit late for those getting back from the mini marathon which I thought was very kind. Will definitely come back to ES Downtown Indy again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fgleason03
Reviews.Content: My friends and I recently stayed at Embassy Suites during Spring break. It was a clean and well-maintained hotel. The location is convenient since it is connected to the circle center mall and has many dining opportunities. The staff was nice and so was the complimentary breakfast. Other than the corridor being a bit loud in the morning, It was perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, broken elevators, and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: molly1429
Reviews.Content: We were there for 2 nights for a cherr competition. The room smelled like cigarettes eventhough it was a non smoking room. The beds were clean but the floors and walls needed major updates. During our stay one elevator was out of order and one broke down with kids in it while we were there. When you park in hte gargare you need to get to the hotel . A bit of a walk. From there you need to get to the lobby. Good luck. There is only a service elevator that the bell hops use to get your luggage to your room. Unless you want to take it up and down the escalator like we did. The pool was the size of a postage stamp. Don't bother bringing your swimsuit. Free breakfast was offered to the guests. What a nightmare. They should separate the drink station from the food station. This would make for much easier traffic flow. The bright side is that it is attached to a mall so you can shop without going outside. The food at the Claypool Grille was good. Overall i wouldn't stay here again. Major updates are needed. Cleaner rooms would be nice. carpets were gross, furniture had cigarette burns and was dirty. You could find better accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Happy Mommy!!!”
Reviews.Author: Momof2gurls
Reviews.Content: Over Spring Break my children and I have made a tradition of staying in Indianapolis for a night or two as a treat. This was one of the worst experiences I have ever had at a hotel. Upon Check in, I asked for a veiw of downtown. I wanted my daughters to be able to enjoy the view. I was given a room with a view of the roof and backside of a building. I was not told about the managers reception and when I came down, and asked where was a place we could get a snack and relax, I was told they were conncected to the mall. After having dinner, when we returned we went to get pop from the vending on our floor to find it only accepted change. I went down to the conceirge and asked where else we could get something to drink from, or get some change and was (again nothing about the managers reception which was going on at this time) told we have room service. I asked if I could just get change for the vending machine. And he seemed to be annoyed and asked how much did I want. I asked for $5(which by the way the pop was $1.50 a piece, I was putting $4.50 back into the machine) the guy acted like I was disturbing him. Also, as I went to make popcorn, the mocrowave was unpugged and I could not reach the plug under the counter to plug it back in. In order to use it I had to carry it to the table to plug it in. This was all in the first night. The next morning I took my kids down for breakfast and according to the room info the breakfast was until 10:30. However at 9:35 when we went down the area was cleared out. They allowed us to eat because the food was still. I do have to say the ladies in there were extremely nice about it. This was one of the only highllights to the stay. However after this it again went downhil. I took my kids to the pool and was told by a cleaning person they were going to be doing a photo shoot so I needed to stay in one area and be sure that I didnt take any towels other than the 4 he handed me. I was quite put off by this. I felt like we were just in the way. I went up got our stuff and began to check out, there was a lady from housekeeping on the floor and I asked her for an extra garbage bag so that I could clean up some of the things that did not fit into the only can that was in the room. And she told me that I needed to wait untill she got to my room. She was only 2 rooms away and would not be cleaning my room while I was there. So i left the garbage on the table. Next to the microwave and left the room. Upon trying to exit the garage I swiped the room card (because I had been charged $22 fee) I was then stopped by the attendant and asked for the parking ticket and I stated I had already paid and she asked for proof. Mind you I had swiped my card already which read my room number and such. I reached in my bag and showed her the check out receipt. Then I finally left and felt more frustrated than I had before I had gotten there. Its a shame that my staycation had to be such a headache. Also for anyone traveling with small children the pooll has 3 steps and goes immediately to 4foot. The floor is made of a tin liner and is quite slippery. My daughters and I kept slipping. Just a warning.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Embassy properties in the chain!”
Reviews.Author: mlsrar
Reviews.Content: I've stayed numerous times at the northside ES property. The downtown location certainly has an edge in a number of areas (location notwithstanding.) One of the best advantages over all other ES properties is the area allocated for the breakfast/reception. There is a ton of seating, two bars/omelette stations, and lots of room to maneuver. We were there during the big-10 tournament and, in spite of the crowds, we never felt boxed in. The rooms have been recently renovated with LCD panels, new bathroom fixtures and carpeting. The noise was tolerable; we were downtown, and there was a college basketball tournament that weekend, but we set our expectations accordingly. The staff was willing to help us out with extra pillows and linens, and didn't seem to mind that we asked. The pool was closed as one of the partiers from an upper floor threw a beer bottle and shattered the glass (not the hotel's fault). The walk to Circle Center mall was only about 5 minutes through the city skywalk system. Overall, it was a great stay. Parking was $20/day with unlimited in/out privileges

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: ArcFlashMan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary. While we were out the first morning there was a plumbing issue in a floor above us that required the hotel turn off the water to all the '14' rooms. Instead of just moving us to a different room with water, which would have been fine, the hotel moved us to a penthouse suite. The second night we had a two-story room with a balcony 200' above downtown Indy. And I used points. The hotel didn't make a dime off of me but still treated me like I owned the place. That's great customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - nice complementary breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: DT808
Reviews.Content: Having access to the convention center from internal walkways is a must in the winter. Rooms were roomy, nice suites. The free breakfasts and afternoon complementary cocktails make it a better value than the other national hotel chains nearby. Since hotels were full, could not check in early, but that is not the fault of the hotel. Was here to attend the NFL combine/agent meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: GBGalaxy
Reviews.Content: Absolutely appalling! The carpet sticks to your feet as does the floor in the bathroom! The bath itself has dirt ingrained in it from since who knows when. The staff are pathetic and rude. Complaints to the Assistant General Manager were totally ignored. Breakfast was like early morning call at the farm! Lifts were constantly going wrong. Overall a desperately poor hotel in terms of service, comfort, cleanliness and facilities

Reviews.Title: “great customer service”
Reviews.Author: mykidsmom3
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a nice hotel. The rooms could use a little attention. The staff was great. Parking and internet is too expensive considering the price you pay for the room. This hotel has an indoor walk way to the mall which is very nice in the winter time.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: kiwibsr1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely and located in the heart of downtown. It had a skywalk to the Circle Centre Mall and is within walking distance of several great attractions! They are undergoing renovations and had signs up that there may be noise in the am, but we didn't have any trouble. They were so accommodating to us, we were staying 2 nights and were supposed to have to switch rooms for the 2nd night, but they let us stay in the same room and smoke in it too! They do offer non smoking rooms, by the way. They brought ashtrays up to the room. We went out Saturday night, and by the time we got back to the hotel, my knee was killing me ( I have lupus) and I didn't have my medicine. They directed us to a vending machine near our room that had Advil in it, and on top of everything, I had started my period! Eek! My husband went to the front desk to ask if there was a Walgreen's or something open 24 hrs for feminine supplies, and the desk clerk reached under the desk and handed him 2 tampons! How kind! I was super grateful! The bed was really comfortable and there were several pillows to choose from. The ONLY negative was that Saturday night around midnight, we saw some security guards walking around the hall, and they knocked on our door. Luckily, we were still awake and dressed! When my husband opened the door, they said, oh we're so sorry, there's something going on, but it's not from your room. So we don't know what they were looking for, but I imagine if we had been asleep, we would not have been real thrilled. But I'm glad that there were security guards around anyway, not that it is a dangerous place, but they were obviously looking for something, so that made me feel safe. A great stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “This was the most uncomfortable room ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Puggleowner
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on business. I was put on the 15th floor. They are currently undergoing renovations so one elevator was out and it took a long time to get to the floor. I was told by one of my friends that the upper rooms were "warm" and that I should crack the window to get some relief. I cracked the window, turned on the ceiling fan, and went to bed around 10pm. I woke up sweating at 2am...the sound of the street was very loud, cars, sirens, etc. The neon lights from the Hilton shown in my window and lit up the room like daylight. You can't shut the drapes and crack the windows as they open at the top. I tried to get to sleep until 4am, when I finally gave up since it was so hot. With the window open warm air was rushing up underneath the door at such a velocity that it was wistling! This air was so dry that my whole mouth dried up and cracked. In addition this is one of the last Hotel chains that charges for daily WiFi...what a rip-off. If you stay here DO NOT GET ON A HIGH FLOOR.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: hirshmom
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several Embassy Suites in the past 6 months (Huntsville and Nashville as well as this one). We choose it because of the suites. However, I was disappointed in our stay here. Staff was not very responsive at check-in. When I tried to do the check-out by phone the next day, no one answered the phone. I had to go to the front desk instead. Pool was small and as another person mentioned, there seemed to be a drainage problem. Walls are thin as well. You could hear everything above and next door which did not make for a restful sleep especially for my daughter who was due to compete at a meet the next day, If my daughter competes in Indianapolis next year, we will be going elsewhere I think.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: logangal23
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time here. Wonderful skywalk to get around downtown without having to go outside. Had a free snack period when we checked in with free drink, snacks, etc... Great for walking distance for various place downtown. Close to Circle Center Mall. Close to a little bit of everything! Will recommend highly to others!

Reviews.Title: “Time for a little TLC please....”
Reviews.Author: Travelfly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with a large group as the National Jamfest for Cheer was on at the convention centre. The location was good yet it did still take us at least 20 minutes to get to the convention centre (indoor route). After a long bus ride check-in was extremely slow. Two people we're working the desk and there we're 2 very long line-ups. The line-ups also began mixing in with the line-ups for the elevator. Upon checking in, we then had to wait just as long, to get on an elevator. One elevator was broken down. The goods things about this hotel are the complimentary breakfast, hands-down one of the best I have ever eaten at. The wait-staff we're great keeping on top of things. The evening reception with drinks and snacks was a benefit as well. We stayed, along with another mother-daughter group in a King Suite. The Bed was great, the pull-out couch was one of the worst mattresses I've seen in a long time. No extra pillows or bedding was provided knowing we had 4 people in the suite. The kids did use the pool, yet for the size of the hotel I was surprised at how small it was. It did have 2 hot tubs and a sauna. Overall-for the price, I would shop around and look at the other hotels attached to the convention centre.

Reviews.Title: “going downhill”
Reviews.Author: RShoe01
Reviews.Content: I love to stay at the Embassy Suites - great breakfast, great amminities. Not this time. The breakfast was pretty bad - eggs were cold and overcooked, bacon was greasy and of low quality. The made to order breakfast was better but took a very long time - waited 15 minutes as there was only 1 person cooking (although there were mutliple stations). The pool was awful. The water was freezing. There must be a problem with drainage as the pool area floors had 1 - 2 inches of standing water. There were no towels at the pool (2 days) and management took 1/2 an hour to bring the towels. When our room was cleaned, we were provided with only two washcloths for the four guests. What a disappointment......

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!”
Reviews.Author: IndianaTripaddict
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel Last Friday night for New Years Eve. Our room was on the 9th floor and we walked the stairs 90 % of the time because of the LONG lines at the elevators. One was broken, the other 3 where SO slow. Our room was Non smoking but it smelled really bad, may have been the dirty socks we found under the hide-a-bed! It was Hot in there and no way to cool it down. YUCK! that bed was awful too! Our view was a brick WALL, but I know the views are always a gamble. We did have great prompt service when asking for more towels and pillows. The shower was dirty and the carpet did not look swept. The Free breakfast was so crazy and loud that I was a nervous wreck when I finally sat down, not worth it! A granola bar and a cup of coffee on the street corner would have been more enjoyable! I have stayed here before and really feel it has went downhill. We have friends that live in Indy and all said they wished they would have known that we booked there because they would have had better choices for us. One friend said that the OFF TRACK Betting/bar under the hotel has changed it for the worse. We love the location and the coffee but that is about it! Oh our youngest daughter did enjoy the pool and hot tub. Next time I will stay at the OMNI, WESTIN<or HILTON

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Quincy25
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I booked a suite for his 30th bday. We did the same for my bday back in Feb and really enjoyed it. His plan was to have friend scome up to the room and hang out then go out downtown. My plan was to throw him a suprise party in the room after dinner at Fogo De Chao (about 3 blocks East). The hotel staff was great and very helpful. They didn't give me any hassle about providing extra keys for guests who were not on the reservation or about decoration restrictions, etc. The party was a success and everyone had a great time. Later in the evening we walked to the bars on Meridian St which are only about 3 blocks south of the hotel. However, after a night of dancing those 3 blocks feel like 8 with sore feet in high heels, ha! I was very happy to see that big comfy bed once we returned to the room. The reservation included a hot buffety type breakfast but it wasn't all that great. Although I would recommend the cooked to order omlettes.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel60845
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel!! Staff was wonderful! Room was great!! Excellent food in the restaurant!! I would recommend this hotel to all!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Great Customer Service. Can't go wrong!!!”
Reviews.Author: hulagirl90
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived the staff was extremely welcoming and courteous, down to the bellhop that went as far as going out of the parking garage and on to the main street to flag down a private shuttle I had scheduled. The rooms are consistently super clean and the location can't be beat with great stores and restaurants within EASY walking distance. You are in the heart of it all at this hotel. The staff will great you with a smile. Thanks Embassy Suites for an enjoyable stay and work conference experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Rosy52_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic! It is located dowtown, next to the mall and surrounded by many restaurants and bars. I liked the service, the breakfast and the happy hour every day. Strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Working to be great.”
Reviews.Author: KNVB_GC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property several times over the past eight years and they are always working to improve the experience. The location is fantastic (within a couple blocks of Lucas Oil Stadium, the Convention Center, and Monument Circle) and they have a huge on-site parking deck. The rooms are very nice, spacious, clean, and presently being renovated along with the elevators. As with all Embassy hotels, a full breakfast (quite good) and evening cocktail hour are included in the daily room rate providing a little extra value. What really sets this property apart is the staff. They all take the time to learn and remember guests so that they can refer to you by name throughout your stay. Additionally, whenever I have expressed even the smallest concern the staff reacts to provide resolution immediately. You can't ask for much more than that!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service was the best I've experienced in a Long Time.”
Reviews.Author: KSMeadowlark
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Embassy Suites Hotel in Downtown Indianapolis, a valet assisted us immediately with unloading luggage, large cooler and many bags. He told us to leave our car right where we had parked it and directed us to the registration desk. He had our luggage and all other items to our suite within just minutes of our arrival. For anyone who has not stayed at an Embassy Suites, the rooms surround an atrium which in this hotel was 20 floors of open, bright and sunny space. Beautiful plants and flowers were everywhere. Clean floors, polished brass, everything was clean and bright. The suite was wonderful. Very large "living room" included a 'fridge, microwave, wetbar and coffee maker. A large LCD TV in the living room, Wi-Fi. The couch opened to a double bed if needed (which we did not). The very large bedroom included a comfy bed and really fabulous pillows. (Where did they find those pillows? I want some here at home.) A large LCD TV was in the bedroom plus a sink, mirror and magnifying mirror. The bathroom was very modern in appearance with tub/shower combo, hair dryer. The suite felt very luxurious. Loved it! But the best part of this hotel is the customer service. Very customer focused and friendly employees. I had contact with 4 different front desk staff during our stay and everyone of them responded to my questions and needs as if I was the most important person that they had talked to in days. The bartender was very pleasant and friendly even with our late arrival ~ after 10 hours of driving, the excellent amaretto sour hit the spot perfectly. Embassy Suites offers a hot breakfast and everyone of the employees keeping the breakfast area clean and stocked were friendly, helpful and fast. It was a very nice experience with not a grumpy employee anywhere to be seen. We will be staying at this hotel in the future and I am really looking forward to that stay.

Reviews.Title: “the only thing this hotel has going for itis the location”
Reviews.Author: mwag5535
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites downtown Indianapolis because of it's location to the Roof Ballroom. The hotel lacks enough elevators. Three out of four elevators were working. Even if the fourth was is operation waits would be excessive. The stairways are locked on cetain floors so that you can use them to go floor to floor.. No inroom safe. Cockroach found in one room of our party. Nothing special about this hotel other than the location

Reviews.Title: “Ok for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: roadlesstraveledNj
Reviews.Content: Not too much of a selection for the managers nightly special, but it is free and the booze is free. The breakfast is very good, and its free. Location is great if you consider downtown indi great. Hotel is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: mauieric
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at the Embassy Suites in Indianapolis June 20-22, 2010. The service and room was excellent. The cooked to order breakfast and managers reception was wonderful. The hotel is downtown and close to shopping and restaurants, and I would love to stay there again at a later date. But beware when entering the self park garage, there is a sharp turn and a narrow entry way into the garage. .

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Downtown Indy with a group”
Reviews.Author: BuckeyeHoosier
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a wedding in Fishers with a group of friends that had never been to Indianapolis prior to this wedding. I suggested we stay downtown and not in Fishers (nothing against Fishers) since there is more to do within walking distance (i.e. no need to worry about designated drivers the night before the wedding). We didn't arrive until 12:40 a.m. and the man working the front desk was very efficient in getting me my keys, etc. for my room. I had already checked-in via the phone since I was originally schedule to arrive eight hours earlier but did not because of a canceled flight from Detroit. So everything was already to go for us to stay on the 16th floor. The room was very nice and the living room and bedroom each have ~32" LCD televisions that do in fact feature HD channels (not just the over-the-air variety (ABC, CBS, NBC, FOX), but your cable channels such as ESPN. This sure helped me from having to find a bar that carried HD channels to watch the FIFA World Cup. Not that its a huge problem to find ABC in HD, but it was nice to have to watch USA/England while getting ready for the wedding. I'm kind of an HD snob... The beds were comfortable and one of my friends insisted on passing out on the couch and claimed it was comfortable (I tried to explain that it does fold out into a bed, he said he was content with the traditional couch-passout method). There is a sink in the bedroom in addition to the sink in the bathroom. The living room features an empty mini-fridge with another sink. The rooms block the sound from the atrium well. You couldn't hear anything from the outside or our neighbors. And hopefully they couldn't hear us while watching the World Cup. The one problem I had with the room was the condition of the bathroom. The sink area was fine, but the tub looked like it was possibly under repair or soon to be under repair. I would disagree with previous reviews of the rooms (as a whole) looking tired because the rest of the room looked like it had recently been renovated... except for the tub/shower area. The exercise room looked nice, but it was small. The business center is free to use (and free printers) and there is a pool as well. You need your room key to access all three. The lobby area is nice and the doorman is more than happy to store your bags for you if need be. The person working the front desk on my last night at 3:30 a.m., was nice to extend check-out for me until 1 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place...nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Mako2002
Reviews.Content: We used our Hilton points to stay here for the Indy 500. So the value was great because it was free!! I loved the location. We could walk to dinner every night and to the parade. It was connected to a mall via a sky walk. The Weber Grille and Panera Bread were in the basement. There was also a horse betting bar in the basement. My husband insisted on betting every night before bed. It was very entertaining. The concierge was great. He had answers for all of our questions and always had a taxi waiting for us. There was a free happy hour everyday...even on the weekends. That was nice. I never tried the free breakfast. I opted for Panera bagels instead. But it looked like everyone else enjoyed breakfast. The hotel was nice but nothing too fancy. It could use some updating. But it was not bad at all. The bed was comfy and they were quick to deliver extra pillows when we called. The elevator was super slow. So we had to plan an extra 5 -10 minutes to get to the lobby from the 14th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Service, location, and amenities 5 star, rooms a bit tired...”
Reviews.Author: CityLover766
Reviews.Content: I would certainly stay here again. The service was really good, and the amenities were wonderful. They had an amazing gym, with a pool/tub area that was clean and nice. Every morning the hotel opens a large dining hall for breakfast. They have everything there including a cooked to order egg station, which is outstanding! And, to top it all off, it is attached to a shopping mall, which is then attached to several other places, like restaurants. This came in extremely handy considering the weather was a bit touch and go. The lobby was nice, too. The only negative is that the rooms were a little bit tired. That's the only negative! Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Emabssy Suites are my Go To Hotel but not in Downtown Indy”
Reviews.Author: LizzChicago
Reviews.Content: I decided to give this Embassy Suites another chance after a few disappointing stays over the last 3 years. The set up of this place just annoys me. It's difficult to get into off the street. I dislike the parking situation. They do not have a valet so you have to park your own car, take a set of elevators down and then an escalator up to check in. Once checked it you take another elevator to the room. The staff is friendly but it doesn't compensate for the odd set up of this building. I think it's an architectural nightmare. The rooms have been updated slightly with some new fixtures and mirrors in the bathroom. My bathtub had a nice crack in it. The bed was ok. I stayed the previous night at the Hilton Garden Inn on the northwest side of the city which had an amazing bed which probably clouded my judgment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and extras for business and/or pleasure trip”
Reviews.Author: Student_10
Reviews.Content: I was in Indianapolis for the first time and the services at the Embassy Suites made my stay more pleasant. They had computers available with printing services for those who couldn't bring a laptop. Internet connection was included at no charge. Complete breakfast included with cook-to-order omeletts among cereal (hot and cold), bread, fruit, yogourt, pancakes, bacon, sausage and more. happy hour from 5:30 to 7:30 with complimentary drinks including wines and other alcoholic beverages. The room service maintained the room clean and prepared with a selection of coffe and tea. Also the rooms have a microwave oven and a small refrigerator. On top of all, serurity boxes available at front desk at no cost. I had to study a lot for my workshop and the facilities provided at the hotel were perfect. Located in the heart of downtown, walking distance to many attractions and in the heat of the city. Clean room and huge suites. Great service with excellent rates. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “great,clean, welcoming and professional”
Reviews.Author: NJbub
Reviews.Content: Just finish a weeks stay and was very pleased with the accomendations , location and the over all friendliness of the staff . The free breakfast , evening reception and central location was A1 . While my wife attended her convention sessions ( about 3 blks ) my grand daughter (11 ) and i were able to walk to most of the attractions in the city . While i totally enjoyed the city the Embassy only put the cherry on top . The one draw back as is for many hotels was that there was a charge for internet connection. Prior to our stay i read mixed reviews but didn't experienced any of the negative statements. All in all we would be thrilled to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat customer - going back in a week”
Reviews.Author: smogunit
Reviews.Content: I've been going with family to the Big 10 Tournement since it began, and when it is in Indy we stay at the Embassy. We always have a good time due to the location to stadium, resturants, and bars. I always eat the free breakfast (pretty average) - and we always hit the comp. cocktail hour(s) - Probably been there 8-10 times in all and will be there in a week - comfortable spot in a great location. A couple of times I've been there and some youth groups stayed there (cheerleading meets / volleyball tourney) and it could be a bit loud a little late.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is old and tired, but well located and reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: phatteus
Reviews.Content: I actually hadn't stayed at an Embassy Suites since the late 90's, and I was surprised to find this hotel was still stuck in that era. My biggest complaint, though you see this in Europe all the time, is that there is no way to lower the room temperature in the winter since the air conditioning system is off. So, if your room is hot, sorry, that's just how its going to be. I was also there for the Jets-Colts game, so they had a full house. The free breakfast was a zoo. They tried to keep up valiantly, but there were 30-person lines to get a drink. Keep that in mind if you are there during an event. Otherwise, the hotel was as advertised and a reasonable value. I'd probably try a different hotel the next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: pachocolate1
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel to stay at downtown but look out for the groups that stay there. They had a youth group and the kids would not go to sleep. They were up making noises outside of the rooms until 2 a.m. I called the front desk and they told me they were having trouble controlling these kids so you may not get much sleep there.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Delivers Yet Again.”
Reviews.Author: HospitalityKid
Reviews.Content: For the New Year holiday, some friends and I decided to book another stay at the Embassy Suites Indianapolis Downtown based on our past wonderful experiences at this property, and they still have never let us down. When we arrived, we were immediately recognized as return guests, which was a theme that continued on with every staff member we encountered. The lobby was rather full when we checked in due to the hotel hosting a group of some kind, but even though they were busy, the staff were all very polite. We loved the evening reception as we always do, the head bartender Cindy is an absolute delight and we love seeing her every time we are there. Breakfast was great all three mornings, especially after partying rather hard for New Year's Eve. I will say that we were a bit concerned with the noise level in the lobby when we returned from clubbing around 4am on the first, but amazingly once we were in our rooms, we could not hear any of the lobby noise. They just finished updating all of their rooms to have the new LCD Tv's in both the living and bedroom areas of the suites and the rooms are very very comfortable. We enjoyed our three night stay at the Embassy as we always do, and will continue to look forward to our stays with them in the future :)

Reviews.Title: “OMG, not cool!”
Reviews.Author: sojourn777
Reviews.Content: Archaic temperature control system. Good grief. No A/C in the winter, no heat in the summer. Good grief, it is 20 degrees outside and I'm burning up in my room and I have not run the heater once. I'm on the 10th floor, good grief heat rises. I can't believe this. If it wasn't for the ceiling fan in the bedroom I would be doomed. I just can't believe this. I happen to love the cold. I can't believe what I paid for this room and have to suffer.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Fun”
Reviews.Author: kmefford99
Reviews.Content: Rooms were spacious and comfortable, enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lots of value”
Reviews.Author: Robbie69
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel, but we were really impressed with the value of what we got! The hotel is in the downtown core, about four blocks from Lucas Oil Stadium. There is an IndyGo stop for the vans to/from the airport right in the front. You can travel on the vans for $7, or $3.50 for seniors (over 65). That beats a $40 cab fare. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. We arrived at noon, and they had a room ready for us by 2 p.m., even though the normal check-in is at 4 p.m. We got a free breakfast that was scrumptuous! I had scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, yogurt, fruit, cinnamon swirl French toast and coffee. They also make omlets to order and they have cereal and a variety of teas and juice. This saved us at least $12 each. They have a "Happy Hour from 5:30-7:30 p.m. I had three marguaritas, plus lots of finger food including swiss cheese cubes, a cheese ball with almonds, chips, salsa and dip, We watched NFL football on the large TV. That saved us about $25 each. There is a morning paper, USA Today. We had a 2-room suite, with a TV in the sitting room and another TV in the bedroom. We had a king-sized bed. The bedroom had a view of the War Memorial. The hotel is also linked directly to the downtown SkyWalk Mall. If it is inclement, you don't even need to go outside to walk around at least 15 city blocks. We were very impressed with the service, location, high atrium lobby with bubble elevators, and all the extras! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay at the Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: ohiomomto3
Reviews.Content: I have to wonder if we stayed at the same hotel as the other reviewers. We had a great experience at this lovely hotel! Our room was on the 16th floor and we had a nice city view. The double beds were comfortable and the room was clean and ready when we checked in at 4pm. The elevators were speedy and we never had to wait more than one minute. The manager's reception was very nice with chips and veggies/dip. The breakfast in the morning was really great with many selections of food and drinks. You cannot beat the location of this hotel! You walk right out into the Arts Garden and over to the mall from there. We had a great time exploring the mall and there is a nice food court there as well so the teens were happy to get their favorite Chick-fil-a. We truly enjoyed walking around the city at night and thought it was just beautiful. The Capital building and the monument are all lit up and it was great for picture taking. We had a very safe feeling walking the streets at night and also enjoyed seeing the horses pulling carriages all over the downtown area. The staff at the Embassy Suites was very helpful and welcoming, especially Brandon who went out of his way to see that we had an excellent stay. If we ever come back to visit this beautiful city, we will definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “never paid soooo much to be sooo disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: ICURNPRN
Reviews.Content: where do I start?? After a 15min wait in line the first attempted to check was unsuccessful, stating the "room was not ready". Returned to the desk an hour later (now was 5pm, check -in is 4pm) as instructed only to wait in line another 15-20 min, only to be told the "room was not ready", AGAIN! we had been travelling since 530am and atttended a few "competitions and were exhausted an wanted to freshen-up before the evening competitions. Finally around 615pm, we got a call from the front desk that the room was ready. we went to the room to find the bathroom sink clogged. I spent the extra few dollars for the "corner-suite" which is bigger (I guess) but NOT worth the money...its big, no decor, needing a serious face lift! we went to the room to find the bathroom sink clogged. we got ready for the evening and told the front desk on the way out. We retutrned to the room around 1130pm and THE SINK WASNT FIXED! I called 2 more times to the front desk before the maintenance man came. he fixed it and left....about 5 min later we were here "strange" noises and found that when he left he LEFT THE DOOR OPEN! Unbeleiveable! Amidst all this.....we NEVER heard from the manager (even when requested for him to call us)...only with the front desk. The kids were hungry when we got back to the room at 1130 and there was NOTHING available!! No room service...only sodas in the vending machines....and the local restuarants were closed/or closing and I was NOT about to navigate through the hotel to get to the street again!!! This hotel is NOT easily accessible!! There are more stairs than you can count. If your handicapped in anyway, FORGET IT! I know, becuase of all the walking I hurt my foot and access to the hotel was an ordeal.....

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, great location”
Reviews.Author: GumshoeOK
Reviews.Content: I'm very surprised that reviewers rated this hotel "terrible!" This was my second or third stay at this hotel, and I've been satisfied every time. My only complaints are that the parking is expensive--$20 per night, and, as with many upscale hotels, free internet service is not provided. There are dozens of good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, and it's within a 5 minute walk of the state government buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Fair to okay Embassy Suites that needs to be improved.”
Reviews.Author: dweebe
Reviews.Content: While the Downtown Embassy Suites is not a horrible hotel, it does need to be improved. First of all; whoever designed the front entrance needs to go back to architecture school. When you arrive you are greeted by steps as well as an almost unusable winding luggage ramp. Plus one you get up the stairs you must take an escalator up to the main lobby level. If you have to use a luggage cart you must use the smelly service elevator. Check in took a while as the woman at the front counter seemed to have a troubling time getting us taken care of. We did get the room requested. Since others stated there were elevator problems we asked for a low floor. Level 4 is the lobby. Meeting rooms are on the 5th and the 6th to 20th levels are guest rooms. We did find the heating and cooling controls to be extremely odd for a modern hotel. It poses a problem trying to get the room comfortable; especially in a swing month like April where you never know what the weather will be. We had to open the window to get cool air and this was not good as our room overlooked an large A/C unit for the Weber Grill restaurant. The lighting in the bathroom was very good. Women doing makeup will appreciate the light. High speed internet was good. But I find it annoying to be charged $11.95/day. The parking garage was a bit of an issue. The ceiling is low and the whole thing is very narrow. People in SUVs will have a hard time navigating and most of the times have to take up two parking spaces. Plus the elevators were out of order and the whole place is underlit. The hotel location can’t be beat though. Plenty of dining and shopping options all within a short distance. The room was clean and well taken care off. Typical Embassy Suites layout. Decent selection of TV channels.
