The living are features a nice, new 37” LG brand HDTV: but only standard def channels are available. At a low price the hotel is an okay option: but if possible I would recommend looking elsewhere. However if you are stuck with staying here, it is certainly passable.

Reviews.Title: “Jazzfest”
Reviews.Author: debra4107travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Downtown during Jamfest January 16 thru 17 2009 My family was four teenage girls. The accomodation were top notch. I was very impressed that the staff handle over 900 girls at check in and also breakfast. The staff was friendly helpful and in some cases very patience with the girls. We will be staying there the next time we come to Indianapolis

Reviews.Title: “Not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: MEMBERNWIN
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Embassy several times and we always seemed to enjoy ourselves, but the last few stays, including this one, were less than enjoyable. Our most recent stay was Thankgiving weekend 2008 for 2 nights with our 2 children and my mother and father in law. I am a Hilton Honors Gold member and other than a few occasions, we always stay with the Hilton chain. The hotel staff are all very friendly and accommodating, it is the hotel itself that needs some improvement. The elevators are painfully slow. It always seemed to take at least 10 minutes to get an elevator and hope that there was room to get on. My advice, whether you are going up or down, get on the first one that comes or you could be waiting a while. One evening we returned to find that my in-laws room key would not work so I went down to the front desk to have it fixed. It took me 25 minutes to get to the desk, have the card fixed (which only took about 3 mins.) and return to the room. Another problem is the climate control rooms. In the winter, you can only use the heat and at other times of the year, only the air conditioning works. The room was miserably hot throughout our stay. The bedroom window can be opened, but with 2 kids and a room on the 17th floor, we did not want to take a chance. The first night we went down to the pool, there were dirty towels everywhere, and not a clean one to be found when we got out. One hot tub did not work, and the other one was all foamy and disgusting looking. Thinking it would be better the second night, we went back down. Same thing, one broken, and the other disguisting. The pool is way too cold, so I sat and watched the kids swim. It was cleaned up and towels were available this time. The breakfast is ok, but the offering had changed. There used to be waffles available, but were not offered while we there. Also, no bagels or flavored hot teas, only Lipton. I appreciate that they offer the free breakfast, but lately the hotel has been priced higher than even the Hilton, which offers a nice bed and breakfast rate for usually a lower rate than the Embassy. The Queen deluxe room at the hilton is like a mini suite. All in all the stay was just ok, but with so many Hilton brands available in the downtown area, I think we will go with one of the other ones next time. I realize it was a holiday weekend, but we have been down at other times and it always seems to be overrun with some sort of event. We have stayed at the Hilton before and it was very nice and the Conrad looks absolutely fabulous. If you are travelling with a group and can get a good rate, this is probably a good choice. If you are travelling with family and want a nice relaxing weekend of swimming and shopping, I would try the hilton or Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly Experience--Hopefully An Aberration”
Reviews.Author: SteveinSoCal
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during a football weekend. The game (despite being a blowout) beat the hotel by a mile. First off, there was a computer glitch that hamstrung the reservations desk terribly upon our arrival. There were dozens of people milling around, waiting for rooms. It was a matter of "get into a line and pray." I was lucky enough to get into a quicker (but not quick) line, which afforded me a mere 45 minute wait. The guy in the line next to me (who had been there for hours, he said) went ballistic. Partially at me. In one respect, I can't blame him. They did not have enough staff for each line, so they were bouncing back and forth. Because my line was the Hilton Honors line, I guess they were keeping one person on that at all times. Bad move...and one that led to a lot of anger. While I grant that their computer system was out of their control, they absolutely botched trying to do it without the technology. How do I know? We were one of several parties who were given a room, given a key, and then promptly headed off to a room...already occupied by another family. It was the most bizarre experience I have ever had in travel. So, we headed back downstairs, where the throng was still mostly assembled. At one point, all of the reservations staff disappeared for nearly half an hour. My guess is that they were meeting in the back wondering what the heck to do. Every now and again, the manager (who, and I should not hold this against him, looked to be about 19) said we'd be helped in "five or ten minutes". After nearly another hour, we were finally assigned a room that was UNOCCUPIED. We asked for the manager, we were told he would call us. We're still waiting. The room was fine (good view of the Capitol dome), but was in some disrepair. Shoddy TV reception, bathroom was a little dirty, etc. The stay did not improve substantially. Housekeeping did not arrive. Ever. Maybe they clean every third day, or something. We were out of the room from 10 AM til 7 PM on our second day, so I don't think it was us. Breakfast at Embassy Suites is usually a high point. The food was adequate, but lines were impossibly long, and there was little or no silverware available on either day. Parking was steep ($20 a night), but in a downtown area I suppose that is to be expected, to an extent. Embassy Suites is usually my first option when I book a hotel. This one--poorly run, showing its age--almost makes me want to rethink that strategy a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: Rareform
Reviews.Content: Very long lines at counter (over an hour wait), all phones in building were not working, room okay but there was hair stuck to the side of the shower, the waits for the elevators were horrendous and when you finally had one open for you it was full, we ended up taking the stairs hidden in the vending room half the time, building was noisy...... Theres also an entrance to a bar at the bottom of the atrium, right inside the doors of the embassy. At one point during the night, a group of about 50-75 people, all rough looking and very noisy, came into the atrium to enter this bar. The bar had been closed but this group insisted on bum rushing the entrance. We honestly did not feel safe. We have stayed at Embassy Suites before and this is the first time we have been unhappy with our experience. If you are going to stay in Indianapolis, and can spare a little extra cash, stay at the Conrad. Much better quality and service.

Reviews.Title: “This visit was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: marcodreamer
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd visit to the hotel. Love the location in downtown Indy - connected to the mall and walking distance to most everything. The previous 2 visits (2004 & 2006) were pretty average. This experience was different from the moment we pulled up. The employee at the front door came right out and held the door for us and directed us to the front desk. We were checked in by Brandon, who asked us our reason for visiting. We told him it was a little get-away for our 25th anniversary. Got to our room which is a typical Embassy Suites room - a little dated - but overall nice and clean. Upon returning from dinner out, arrived in our room to find a bottle of champagne, a plate of strawberries and whipped cream and a very nice hand written card from Brandon wishing us a very happy anniversary! It was such a wonderful surprise and gesture. The rest of the visit was just as nice. Every employee we encountered was very friendly and seemed genuinely interested in helping us. Breakfast and Happy Hour were very good also. It really seems like they either have new management (since 2006) or they have had additional training on customer service. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Embassy”
Reviews.Author: Chiman03
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort on a three day field trip. It was a great experience of Indianapolis. The resort was right downtown, which gave us a breath taking view. The bright atrium welcomed us to the resort. The staff was very helpful. The suite we stayed in was awesome! It had a living room and a bedroom. The bedroom had two queen beds and a dresser. The room also had a nice t.v. and table. The living room had a t.v. with a key board connection. It had a couch that pulled out to a bed. Also it had a mini fridge and a microwave. The bathroom was nice and clean with a double sink and shower/tub. The breakfast is great and was the cleanest buffet I have ever ate at. It had a great variety of eggs, pancakes, waffles; danish, and cereal. It also had great coffee. The location was just great! walking distance to monument circle, the capitol, shops and famous resturants. Also for the shoppers, there is a mall attached to Embassy suites! I recemend this resort to anyone. Hope you choose here, because I want you to have the same amount of fun we had.

Reviews.Title: “great experience, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: docneneng
Reviews.Content: i was very impressed with the embassy suites downtown. the front desk staff were very friendly. i traveled alone to attend a conference but i got a king suite which was more than enough space for me. i think 4 people (as long as they dont mind sharing the bed and 1 bathroom) can comfortably stay in the room. there was a pullout sofa bed in the 1st room/living room? with a separate tv from the bedroom. there was a door to separate the 2 rooms and offer some privacy if it was a group of people. one of the nice perks i enjoyed was the free manager's reception at 530pm for drinks and snacks and the free hot breakfast, more than your usual bagels and cereal breakfast that you get in motels/inns. im planning to go back this summer to visit indy again (since i did not get to see a lot of places in the city because i was pretty impressed already with the stuff to do downtown). i am considering staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Afraid Of Heights?”
Reviews.Author: ecacciav
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the staff was friendly, and the breakfast was good. But, don't stay here if you are afraid of heights. The space above the lobby is open to the top of the building, and you can see all 20 floors of balcony on all four sides of the building. All rooms open onto a 4 or 5 foot wide balcony. Don't look down.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: urbanaualumni
Reviews.Content: I expected so much better from an Embassy Suites, wow were we shocked. Let's start with the good: The staff were incredibly friendly especially helpful was the concierge, who was a great guide to downtown and what places to eat and he was right on with the prices etc...... The breakfast buffet was great, but you better be an early riser if you do not want to wait in a VERY long line. The excercise room was great and the pool is much smaller than in the photos, but that is to be expected. Now to the bad: We woke up Saturday to no hot water. Then when the hot water heater was repaired, the water would either be scalding hot or freezing cold while you were in the shower. The rooms were scorching HOT and apparently the controllers in the rooms are dummies. The staff explained that the heat is controlled by the city and it is steam heat. In actuality the motel has no control over the heat. The web site notes $20.00 for parking, make sure you are aware that is per nite! We opened the curtains to see the view and were greeted by peeling paint.... ugh! And, the window was soaked wtih condensation due to the HOT room and cold outside. The moisture dripped down on to our bags. We had to wait in long lines to use the elevator, due to an inadequate number, having 4 to serve the entire building. Also, we had six people in the room and requested towels. We waited for over 4 hours when we had to stop houskeeping in the hall to finally get them. The next day they took the dirty ones and we again had to hunt down someone for more. All in all, I wish I would have spend a little more to have better quality. In all actuality, after paying the parking fees, we ended up paying the same as other hotels that I passed on. On yeah, dont plan on bringing Playstation or a DVD player because they have the menu on the televisions disabled so you can pay $15.00 for a movie and rent a game. UGH! Never again...... dont stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & convenience”
Reviews.Author: tewsc1
Reviews.Content: This property is in the heart of downtown and connected by a skywalk to a large mall. The rooms/suites are updated and clean. Service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve Stay”
Reviews.Author: ACCAH
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending New Year's Eve at the Embassy Suites in downtown Indy. After reading several reviews, I was nervous to see what we might find. Overall we had a positive experience--the happy hour and breakfast were good--although they had a hard time keeping up the morning after the Colts game as they were very busy! Although they said the pool would be open by Dec. 31st--it never opened due to construction....which did not make our 2 and 4 year old happy. Highlights: Location--it was great to wear the kids out by walking the mall without ever going outside, it was also connected to the Artsgarden where we attended a beautiful New Year's Eve wedding reception. We paid $139/night plus the $20 for parking and I feel that is the caliber of hotel we received. We met friends for drinks at the Conrad next door....much nicer lobby,etc...however the rooms were $100+ more a night. This was a perfect place for our family to stay b/c of the ample breakfast and suite type rooms. I would also recommend the Indy Children's Musuem to anyone visiting with children...it was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: CarolAnnMichigan
Reviews.Content: Room outdated. Dirty curtains with cigarette burns in the curtains. Worn and dirty sofa, very uncomfortable. Carpeting worn down in places to the burlap. Toilet overflowed, sink slow to drain. Walls with dirty stains and dust. You would not want to touch the phone to make a phone call, it too was dirty. Dust and debris behind the bed. There was "roll pillows" on the bed that need to be rolled up and thrown in the trash as they were disgustingly dirty. A very disappointing stay. The $20.00 a night charged for parking should be put aside to refurbish the rooms. It could be a nice place.....The location is great. Not what I expected from a Hilton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: defore4735
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the weekend at this hotel. Overall, I would rate it as an average Embassy Suites hotel. The Good: 1. Breakfast was good. Nice ladies working the area. The reception was good as well. 2. Location is downtown Indy and the hotel connects to Circle Center which is an upscale mall. Plenty of things for kids to do including movies. 3. The location also has nice restaurants not only inside the mall but near the hotel as well. The Bad: 1. Parking is horrible. You pay $20 / day for self park, but this is downtown Indy. 2. The hotel has been updated some, but televisions aren't great. Standard old screens. 3. Temperature in the hotel is screwed up. They run the heat starting in October and air conditioning in May. If you need either one other than that time, you're out of luck. Their response, open your window and crack your door to let the air in, or we could send you a fan. Would I stay there again, only with a family. If I were traveling on my own, would likely stay in the Hyatt or the Westin. Better beds.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service & parking”
Reviews.Author: lmpaddock
Reviews.Content: On the weekend of September 21-23, we used Embassy Suites, not only for our wedding hotel block for our guests, but also for our rehearsal dinner. The dinner went off without a hitch, which was great. However, the hotel had several problems. For one thing, several of my guests requested early check-in. When they were told to "come back in a few hours", they did and a room was STILL not cleaned and ready. I find this complete unacceptable. Also, and most importantly, the parking is atrocious. I booked this hotel for my guests because it was close to my wedding reception site. Some guests chose to come to the hotel, park, and then take a 3 minute cab ride to the reception. However, due to ZERO parking places in the garage, my in-laws and grandparents-in-law were VERY late to our reception and missed several important events! It is my feeling that if you want attentive and efficient customer service, do not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dixonconsultinginc
Reviews.Content: Needed a place with easy walking distance to Victory Field and comfort for the family. This was it. The room was perfect and the family loved the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: JB24003
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites in downtown Indianapolis in late April 2007 (22nd through the 25th). It was part of a business trip, booked by my company's events planner, as it was for a conference we were holding at the RCA Dome and Convention Center. My initial expectations were to expect an average hotel stay, after reading the previous reviews of the place and hearing about the other nearby hotels (others in our company were staying at the Marriott, Hyatt Regency, and Westin hotels). I was pleasantly surprised left and right at Embassy Suites. Apparently a major remodel has been completed, and the rooms and hotel show it. From the check-in, which was handled quickly and easily by the staff at the front, to the room, cleaning, and check-out procedures, I had no hiccups or trouble. The room is amply sized, with the front room containing a TV, a couch, large chair, a table with two chairs, and a bar area with a mini-fridge and microwave. The bathroom was in between the two rooms, and was fine for one or two people -- the counter was solid marble, and everything was clean. The bedroom had a king-sized bed, with loads of pillows (love extra pillows), an armoire with pull-out TV, a sink/make-up area, and full-length windows with blackout shades. As I mentioned above, the cleaning staff was superb, with everything clean and tidy when I came back exhausted every day after the conference. I will admit that there were a few things out of place when I first arrived -- an empty soda bottle on the floor underneath one of the tables, burnt-out lights in the bathroom, and a broken hot-water handle for the sink in the bathroom (there were 2 other sinks I could use, though). All of this -- all of it -- was fixed and clean without my asking by the next morning. I saw it as a temporary oversight, nothing to worry about. One other niggle might be that the lobby is on the 4th floor -- not immediately obvious to newcomers going up or down the elevator or arriving from street level. Coming off the street you might be tempted to look to check-in at the off-track betting area on the lower level. :) I would definitely go back, and would recommend this place to others, whether visiting Indianapolis for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Circle City Classic”
Reviews.Author: GeoSoul
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Embassy Suites during the Circle City Classic in October 2006. We usually look for an Embassy hotel when we travel because it is a great value. We have typically been very pleased with the Embassy. Our stay in Indianapolis was OK, but somewhat disappointing in comparison to other stays. Here the the PROS and CONS: PROS: The hotel is literally in the heart of DT Indy and you can easily walk to local restaurants, the stadium, etc. The hotel is actually connected to the Circle City Centre (mall) so that you can get there without going outside. This is really nice when the weather isn't so great & the mall is really nice. You can also walk to the capital and the civil war museum, which is free, although a bit creepy in the inside (dark & dank). The suites are a nice size, but the decor is a bit dated. It was still clean overall & beats a regular hotel room by a long shot. The manager's breakfast & evening reception add LOTS of value for your stay. They are included free with your stay. It's a full breakfast in the morning (bacon, egs, omelets, etc) and snacks & drinks in the evening. It's best to get there early as both fill up fairly quickly. Seating place is limited, but you can take items back to your room. CONS: We stayed at this hotel in October and found out upon check-in that you can't control the heat in your room. It is controlled by the hotel and they had not yet turned it on for the year for some reason or another. We were FREEZING most of the weekend. This took a lot away from our satisfaction with our stay. There was a note in the room suggesting that we use the ceiling fan to help control the temp! I'm sorry, but when it's only 40 or so degress outside, running a ceiling fan is not going to warm the room to a comfortable level. The hotel lobby was always dark...even in the day. Catching an elevator was a challenge, but that might have been because there were so many people in town for the Circle City Classic. The hotel was also EXTREMELY noisy--Lots of teens, young children running around w/o adult supervision. Of course, that's to be expected whenever a major event is going on, but you just need to be aware of it. Overall, the Embassy is usually a good value for what you pay versus what you get. However, we will probably stay at the Hyatt in the future. Not being able to control the room temp is a BIG problem...expecially in the Midwest. Unless you are traveling at a time when room temp will be comfortable, I'd say to stay someplace else. This hotel is in the heart of the action, but so are other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: UMgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Had a very nice King suite with a mini-fridge, micro, table and chairs and sofa bed. There were also 3 sinks!!!!(bathroom, living room/kitchen and bedroom). The bed was very comfy with lots of pillows and the the room was very spacious. The view was nice as well-we were on the 10th floor. The best part about this hotel is the reception with alcohol and snacks and the amazing breakfast. I plan on staying at an ES every chance I get from now on. Staff was very pleasant as well. Location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Do not use the parking garage next to the Hotel !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lastlap
Reviews.Content: The first thing it was 80 deg. in our room and they told us to open the window because you cannot adjust your heat in your room. So we listened to the traffic all night. We checked out Saturday at 11:00am and found out our vehicle had been broken into and there were several that got broken into. Very little security. The hotel tells us that it is not there parking lot , but it is connected to there hotel and they bill you $18.00 a day to park there. I would stay somewhere else !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good & bad”
Reviews.Author: BaldLoonie
Reviews.Content: Older place, kept clean but needs some updating. Housekeeping does a nice job but some signs of age in the room. One room had some peeling wallpaper from water leak around window. Both rooms needed carpet shampooed. Couch and chair in the living room old, couch not that comfy. Great bed though, lots of nice pillows. 2 TVs, good channel choice, some didn't have the greatest picture. Rooms warm, no cooling available this time of year but window does open and many were. Lobby comfortable and clean, elevators fast with little wait. Small indoor pool and 2 small whirlpools plus exercise area. Great morning breakfast, didn't do the nightly cocktail party. Skywalk to Circle Centre Mall and beyond to convention center & dome. Yes, $18 parking and long wait to get out of ramp annoying but parking is steep in downtown Indy. Place would be fine discounted from an online site. Not sure its a deal at full price. There are many newer hotels downtown that are nicer.
